headline: American Water Works (AWK) Q3 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates
summary: American Water Works (AWK) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +2.11% and +9.61%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

content.title: American Water Works (AWK) Q3 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates
content.summary: American Water Works (AWK) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +2.11% and +9.61%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: American Water Works: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: CAMDEN, N.J. (AP) — American Water Works (AWK) on Wednesday reported third-quarter net income of $379 million. On a per-share basis, the Camden, New Jersey-based company said it had net income of $1.94. The results beat Wall Street expectations.

content.title: American Water Works: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: CAMDEN, N.J. (AP) — American Water Works (AWK) on Wednesday reported third-quarter net income of $379 million. On a per-share basis, the Camden, New Jersey-based company said it had net income of $1.94. The results beat Wall Street expectations.

headline: AMERICAN WATER REPORTS STRONG THIRD QUARTER 2025 RESULTS; AFFIRMS LONG-TERM TARGETS AND 2025 EPS GUIDANCE; INITIATES 2026 EPS GUIDANCE, REFLECTING GROWTH OF 8%; ANNOUNCED MERGER WITH ESSENTIAL UTILITIES, EXPECTED CLOSING Q1 2027
summary: CAMDEN, N.J., October 29, 2025--American Water Works Company, Inc. (NYSE: AWK) today reported results for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, of $1.94 per share, compared to $1.80 per share for the same quarter in 2024, and $4.47 per share for the year-to-date period ended September 30, 2025, compared to $4.17 per share for the same period in 2024.

content.title: AMERICAN WATER REPORTS STRONG THIRD QUARTER 2025 RESULTS; AFFIRMS LONG-TERM TARGETS AND 2025 EPS GUIDANCE; INITIATES 2026 EPS GUIDANCE, REFLECTING GROWTH OF 8%; ANNOUNCED MERGER WITH ESSENTIAL UTILITIES, EXPECTED CLOSING Q1 2027
content.summary: CAMDEN, N.J., October 29, 2025--American Water Works Company, Inc. (NYSE: AWK) today reported results for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, of $1.94 per share, compared to $1.80 per share for the same quarter in 2024, and $4.47 per share for the year-to-date period ended September 30, 2025, compared to $4.17 per share for the same period in 2024.

headline: Water UP! Opens Career Pathways for Essex County’s Future Workforce
summary: CAMDEN, N.J., October 29, 2025--New Jersey American Water recently launched its fifth annual Water UP! – Water Utility Pipeline – training program, now hosted at Essex County College (ECC) in partnership with the company’s Short Hills Operations Center. This 10-week workforce development initiative is designed to prepare trainees for careers in the water utility industry through classroom instruction, field training, and professional development.

content.title: Water UP! Opens Career Pathways for Essex County’s Future Workforce
content.summary: CAMDEN, N.J., October 29, 2025--New Jersey American Water recently launched its fifth annual Water UP! – Water Utility Pipeline – training program, now hosted at Essex County College (ECC) in partnership with the company’s Short Hills Operations Center. This 10-week workforce development initiative is designed to prepare trainees for careers in the water utility industry through classroom instruction, field training, and professional development.

thumbnail.caption: Participants of the 2025 Water UP! class pose on the first day of training with New Jersey American Water President Mark McDonough (center) and Doreene Bennett (far right), workforce development program manager.

headline: Iowa American Water Proudly Recognizes American Water Charitable Foundation 2025 Workforce Readiness Grantee
summary: DAVENPORT, Iowa, October 29, 2025--The American Water Charitable Foundation, a philanthropic non-profit organization established by American Water (NYSE: AWK), the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the U.S., announced today that the North Scott Community School District has been awarded a $35,000 Workforce Readiness grant, to support the Regional Innovation Center, which assists high school students in communities served by Iowa American Water.

content.title: Iowa American Water Proudly Recognizes American Water Charitable Foundation 2025 Workforce Readiness Grantee
content.summary: DAVENPORT, Iowa, October 29, 2025--The American Water Charitable Foundation, a philanthropic non-profit organization established by American Water (NYSE: AWK), the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the U.S., announced today that the North Scott Community School District has been awarded a $35,000 Workforce Readiness grant, to support the Regional Innovation Center, which assists high school students in communities served by Iowa American Water.
